channel.title: My Uncutweb forum/tutorial software version 1
channel.description:
Well I am finally finished with version 1, I am now out of beta.
I have recoded so many things since the beta, I made my own simple template system.
If you guys could, check for bugs, security problems, etc, before I make this site a production.
WEBSITE: http://www.uncutweb.com
The feature I am most proud of is the fact that I do not use any tables in the current version. I also do not use any hacks like an image repeating-y.
My tutorial script is partly completed. I still have to create the feature that will let the registered users post tutorials.
I also want to thank OnlyOneRule for tutoring PHP to me when I needed help the most.
[b]Screenshots of older versions.[/b] This is where I will post screenshots of the older versions so you guys can see my progress.
[b]Beta 1:[/b] This is the first version I have ever made.
[img]http://i44.tinypic.com/xkyu5t.jpg[/img]
[b]Beta 3:[/b] This is the third version I have made. This one used better CSS styling.
[img]http://i42.tinypic.com/2cqhgeo.jpg[/img]
[b]Beta 4:[/b] This was the last beta version.
[img]http://i43.tinypic.com/15mxv6a.jpg[/img]
[b]Final Beta 1:[/b] This was the final beta version that was the previous release to the current one you see right now.
[img]http://i44.tinypic.com/33tpfes.jpg[/img]

item.title: My Uncutweb forum/tutorial software version 1
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Very good, and are you Cursed from pethorn?

Read full topic

item.title: My Uncutweb forum/tutorial software version 1
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Yes thanks!

I never knew that, I was trying to figure out why it was arguing over my url. XD

Uriko:

Nice progress. Banner needs to be changed, though. Did you create the forum software yourself?

Yeah, OnlyOneRule helped me with a few tight ends though.

Read full topic

item.title: My Uncutweb forum/tutorial software version 1
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It looks great, I do have one comment though, it doesn’t validate:

http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.uncutweb.com%2Findex.php%3Fpage%3Dforum;accept=text%2Fhtml%2Capplication%2Fxhtml%2Bxml%2Capplication%2Fxml%3Bq%3D0.9%2C*%2F*%3Bq%3D0.8;accept-language=en-us%2Cen%3Bq%3D0.5;accept-charset=ISO-8859-1%2Cutf-8%3Bq%3D0.7%2C*%3Bq%3D0.7

However, it is a problem rather easily fixed, the ‘&’ in your URLs need to be ‘&’ instead. Other than that great job.

Read full topic

item.title: My Uncutweb forum/tutorial software version 1

item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Wow, I didn’t think this was gonna get anywhere.

Good job.

Read full topic

@bjc22 wrote:

Well I am finally finished with version 1, I am now out of beta.

I have recoded so many things since the beta, I made my own simple template system.

If you guys could, check for bugs, security problems, etc, before I make this site a production.

WEBSITE: http://www.uncutweb.com

The feature I am most proud of is the fact that I do not use any tables in the current version. I also do not use any hacks like an image repeating-y.

My tutorial script is partly completed. I still have to create the feature that will let the registered users post tutorials.
